data.name: Eulerian motion
data.description:
When the rocket flies, it is acted upon by the Euler motion, which changes the angular velocity and rotates the rocket. You need to calculate how it's changes.
For do this we have the dynamic Euler equation

![alt](http://stu.alnam.ru/archive/arch.php?path=../htm/lect_teor_m2/files.book&file=teor_m2_18.files/image8.gif)

and kinetic Euler equation
![alt](http://konspekta.net/studopediaorg/baza4/747864720837.files/image731.png)

And we got a start position: ```vector<double> Position={P0,Q0,R0,Fi0,Teta0,Psi0}```.

You need to integrate this systems at start position by Runge-Kutta 4th order 

![alt](http://old.exponenta.ru/soft/mathcad/stud20/images_1/06.gif)

to have next position at setting step ```h```.

Input data:
```A```, ```B```, ```C```, ```Gx```, ```Gy```, ```Gz```, ```h``` and ```vector<double> Position={P0,Q0,R0,Fi0,Teta0,Psi0}```;

Output data:
```vector<double> Result={P1,Q1,R1,Fi1,Teta1,Psi1}```;

Mark: ```Fi```, ```Teta```, ```Psi``` are given in degrees. You must convert to radians ```M_PI/180``` to make the calculation and in answer return to degree. And ```0<=Fi<360```, if ```Fi<0``` or ```Fi>=360``` you must ```+360``` or ```-360``` until ```Fi``` get to the range, the same is  ```Teta``` and ```Psi```. And the values are rounded to 3 decimal places
